pullrequest.title: Fix joint visualization axis frame issue

content.raw:
I remember there was some discussions a while ago that to come up with visual representation that capture the case where main joint axis vector (specified by `<xyz>`) is not one of the unit x, y, or z axes of the joint frame. So we came up with using yellow to draw this axis. 

Most of the time it coincides with the joint frame's x, y, or z axis, in this case I hide the the one it overlaps with. If you think it's better we can revert to the original behavior and think of another way to visualize the joint axis vector.
